and SnSe single crystals have isotropic

erent inclusion types, it was found that for the composite with
the same component volume fraction, the ﬁbrous and layered composites yielded very similar
T values. However, it should be noted that the peak performances of the layered and
ﬁbrous composites under the same volume fraction were not identical to each other. The

By comparing the results between the composite with anisotropic component material and
isotropic component material, it was found that the anisotropic component in single-crystal form
in both the layered transverse thermoelectric composite and the ﬁbrous transverse thermoelectric
composite can provide a better cooling performance comparedto their isotropic polycrystal counterpart.
